Package se.arkalix.net.http.consumer

Interface HttpConsumer

  • All Superinterfaces:
    ArConsumer
    public interface HttpConsumer
extends ArConsumer
    Client useful for consuming an secure or insecure HTTP service.

    This class provides similar functionality to HttpClient, with the exception that hostnames, encodings, authorization tokens and other details may be managed automatically.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface Description
      static class  HttpConsumer.Factory
      Class used for creating HttpConsumer instances.

      • Methods inherited from interface se.arkalix.ArConsumer

        service

    • Method Detail

      • create

        static HttpConsumer create​(ArSystem system,
                           ServiceDescription service)
        Creates new service consumer.
        Parameters:
        system - Arrowhead system consuming service.
        service - Service to be consumed.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - If system or service is null.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the security modes of system and service do not match (e.g. the system is secure but the service is not).

      • create

        static HttpConsumer create​(ArSystem system,
                           ServiceDescription service,
                           java.util.Collection<EncodingDescriptor> encodings)
        Creates new service consumer, limiting itself to a subset of the encodings supported by service.
        Parameters:
        system - Arrowhead system consuming service.
        service - Service to be consumed.
        encodings - Supported request/response encodings. If specified as null, the encodings returned by EncodingDescriptor.allWithDtoSupport() are used.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - If system or service is null.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the security modes of system and service do not match (e.g. the system is secure but the service is not).

      • factory

        static HttpConsumer.Factory factory()
        Gets default HttpConsumer.Factory, used to create new HttpConsumer instances.
        Returns:
        Default HttpConsumer.Factory.

      • connect

        default Future<HttpConsumerConnection> connect()
        Creates new HttpClientConnection for communicating with the service associated with this consumer.
        Returns:
        Future completed with a new client if and when a TCP connection has been established to remoteSocketAddress.

      • connect

        Future<HttpConsumerConnection> connect​(java.net.InetSocketAddress localSocketAddress)
        Creates new HttpClientConnection for communicating with the service associated with this consumer.
        Parameters:
        localSocketAddress - Socket address of local network interface to use when communicating with remote host.
        Returns:
        Future completed with a new client if and when a TCP connection has been established to remoteSocketAddress.

      • send

        default Future<HttpConsumerResponse> send​(HttpConsumerRequest request)
        Connects to remote host at remoteSocketAddress, sends request, closes connection and then completes the returned Future with the result.
        Parameters:
        request - Request to send.
        Returns:
        Future completed with the request response or an error.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - If remoteSocketAddress or request is null.

      • isSecure

        boolean isSecure()
        Determines whether or not this HTTP client communicates via HTTPS or not.
        Returns:
        true only if this client uses HTTPS.
